definition: to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly

sentences.english: You don't want to get chilblains like I did the first time I went out on the snow.
sentences.chinese: 你不想跟我一樣，第一次到雪地上去就得了凍瘡吧？

sentences.english: Hot water, fry eggplants root nozzle, fumigation chilblain.
sentences.chinese: 茄子根煎水，趁熱薰洗患處，可治凍瘡。

sentences.english: The soles of his feet were raw with chilblain.
sentences.chinese: 他的腳底生了凍瘡很疼痛。

sentences.english: The serious chilblain on what method handle cures?
sentences.chinese: 有什麼方法把手上嚴重的凍瘡治好？

sentences.english: Prevent chapping and cure chilblain with fine nature.
sentences.chinese: 觸感細膩自然，防爆裂治凍瘡。

sentences.english: But unless someone is prepared, outdoor fun can also mean frostbite and hypothermia .
sentences.chinese: 但是除了有準備的人，戶外娛樂也意味着凍瘡和低溫。

sentences.english: There was a man in our State of Song who could make medicine for preventing chilblains.
sentences.chinese: 我們宋國有一個人，會製作防止凍瘡的藥。

sentences.english: And frostbite is more common at pretty low temperatures, well below freezing.
sentences.chinese: 而處於遠低於冰點的相當低溫度中，凍瘡更常見。

sentences.english: How long it takes you to develop frostbite will depend on the conditions.
sentences.chinese: 據國家氣象局說，多長時間會生凍瘡要視環境而定。

sentences.english: Her lips so big, Chap Stick had to invent a spray.
sentences.chinese: 她嘴脣這麼大，抹凍瘡膏必鬚髮明噴射裝置。

sentences.english: The ugly scar on my hands shows chilblain, once again.
sentences.chinese: 在我手上醜陋的傷痕又一次變成了凍瘡。

sentences.english: Comparisons were made between the two groups in terms of average healing and antipruritic effect.
sentences.chinese: 比較兩種方法治療凍瘡的平均癒合時間和止癢效果。
